turns.content:
I apologize for the confusion, here are the 3 new chord progressions containing only the notes in the F halfdim scale, with all chords transposed or suspended as necessary:

| Progression 1 | Progression 2 | Progression 3 |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) | Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) | Fm7 (F, Ab, C, Eb) |
| Bb7sus4 (Bb, F, Ab) | Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) | Ab7sus4 (Ab, C, Eb) |
| Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) | Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) | Bbm7sus4 (Bb, F, Ab) |
| Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) | Fmaj7 (F, A, C, E) | Cm7 (C, Eb, G, Bb) |
|  |  | Eb7sus4 (Eb, G, Bb, Ab) |

Please note that the chords in these progressions may have a different overall sound from the original chords. But it's still can be used as a tool for improvisation, composition, and practicing.

Im very very pleased, even if progression 2 has an unedited Fmaj7 with an A still remaining. I totally understand it not being optimal or 1:1 to the original chords. Please redraw the table without the A in Fmaj7

| Chord Progression 3 | Notes in Chords |
| --- | --- |
| Fm7(F, Ab, C, Eb) |  |
| Bb7sus4(Bb, F, Ab) |  |
| Cm7(C, Eb, G, Bb) |  |
| Eb7(Eb, G, Bb) |  |

| Chord Progression 4 | Notes in Chords |
| --- | --- |
| Fm7(F, Ab, C, Eb) |  |
| Cm7(C, Eb, G, Bb) |  |
| Eb7(Eb, G, Bb) |  |
| Fmaj7(F, A, C, E) |  |

| Chord Progression 5 | Notes in Chords |
| --- | --- |
| Fm7(F, Ab, C, Eb) |  |
| Ab7sus2(Ab, C, Eb) |  |
| Bbm7(Bb, Db, F, Ab) |  |
| Cm7(C, Eb, G, Bb) |  |

Fm7: [F3, C4, Eb4] Bbm7: [Bb3, Eb4, F4] Cm7: [C4, Eb4, G4] Ebm7: [Eb4, G4, Bb4] Fm7: [F4, Ab4, C5] Gm7: [G3, Bb3, D4] Abmaj7: [Ab4, C5, Eb5] Bbm7: [Bb4, Eb5, F5] C5: [C5]

| Bbm7 | Bb4, Eb5, F5 |

Eb6: Eb, G, Bb

please format this chord progression aswell
